com.xebialabs.overthere

Interface OverthereProcess

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalProcess

    public interface OverthereProcess
    Represents an executing process.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Forcibly terminates the process.
      int exitValue()
      Returns the exit value for the process.
      java.io.InputStream getStderr()
      Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard error stream (stderr) of the process.
      java.io.OutputStream getStdin()
      Returns an output stream that is connected to the standard input stream (stdin) of the process.
      java.io.InputStream getStdout()
      Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard output stream (stdout) of the process.
      int waitFor()
      Waits for the command to complete its execution.

    • Method Detail

      • getStdin

        java.io.OutputStream getStdin()
        Returns an output stream that is connected to the standard input stream (stdin) of the process.
        Returns:
        the input stream

      • getStdout

        java.io.InputStream getStdout()
        Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard output stream (stdout) of the process.
        Returns:
        the output stream

      • getStderr

        java.io.InputStream getStderr()
        Returns an input stream that is connected to the standard error stream (stderr) of the process.
        Returns:
        the output stream

      • waitFor

        int waitFor()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for the command to complete its execution. Returns immediately if the process has already terminated.
        Returns:
        the exit value of the process
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if this method was interrupted

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Forcibly terminates the process. Returns immediately if the process has already terminated.

      • exitValue

        int exitValue()
              throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException
        Returns the exit value for the process.
        Returns:
        the exit value of the process
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - if the process has not yet terminated.
